roleset.name: have a sensation or experience
roleset.note: EXPERIENCE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'experience' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Comparison with detect and undergo. (from experience.01-v predicate notes)
EXPERIENCE-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls sight-30.2. (from experience.01-n)
EXPERIENCED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from experienced.01-j)

example.name: typical
example.text: Suppliers and subcontractors are experiencing heightened pressure to support delivery schedules.
example.arg: heightened pressure to support delivery schedules

example.name: passivized
example.text: ``I believe that the perception that legislation in this area may be hastily approved contributed to the collapse of the UAL transaction, and [the resulting disruption]-1 in the financial markets experienced *trace*-1 this past Friday,'' Mr. Trump wrote members of Congress.

example.name: Adjective example
example.text: You are two years more experienced , travelled , and adventurous .

example.name: autogen1
example.text: the bank 's experience with LDC debt

example.name: both args
example.text: your personal experience of having been on the cruise
example.arg: of having been on the cruise

example.name: with LOC
example.text: her experience on the Simpson case

roleset.name: accumulated instances of participation, and the knowledge derived
roleset.note: EXPERIENCE-N, EXPERIENCED-J NOTES: Added by Julia for Lorelei.

role.descr: entity with a history of participation

example.name: experience-n
example.text: One of the most interesting aspects of the new likely team under the Bush administration is first of all , extensive experience in defense and military affairs .

example.name: experienced-j
example.text: He is experienced at managing large teams of engineers across all of KJWW's disciplines.
example.arg: at managing large teams of engineers across all of KJWW's disciplines
